bug.author: lamberta
bug.description:
The tf-nightly-2.0-preview package does not exist anymore. Please upgrade all notebooks to use %tensorflow_version 2.x like: <denchmark-code>try: # %tensorflow_version only exists in Colab. %tensorflow_version 2.x except Exception: pass </denchmark-code>
Affects:
/site/ja/lite/convert/python_api.md /site/ja/guide/function.ipynb /site/ja/tutorials/load_data/csv.ipynb

comments.comment: Thank you for your notification, we'll update & fix them.

I think <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/152>tensorflow/docs-l10n#152</denchmark-link> fixed this issue. However, we have to update these outdated documents.
/site/ja/lite/convert/python_api.md ja/tutorials/load_data/csv.ipynb (it's broken as mentioned https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/issues/138)
I'm going to update them and make two PRs for each document.

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AseiSugiyama>@AseiSugiyama</denchmark-link> for taking a look. Now that Colab defaults to TF 2.2, we can remove the %tensorflow_version 2.x block from notebooks. Mark just merged <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/152>tensorflow/docs-l10n#152</denchmark-link> which should remove them, but we may need to keep an eye on any outstanding pull requests

Right, I would like to contribute to the TF community to be an "eye" ðŸ‘€ By the way, I found it is hard to update translated documents to follow the original document since we lack the sync tool like nb_code_sync.py after separating docs repo and docs-l10n repo. Do you have any ideas about this?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AseiSugiyama>@AseiSugiyama</denchmark-link> Hello. should still work, you can pass it the argument. But, point taken, I'll look into streamlining that tool now that the repos are separate

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lamberta>@lamberta</denchmark-link> How about the result of your taking a look? I think it is not obvious the way to maintain the directory and other languages' directory that we can use with git only because and are separated.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AseiSugiyama>@AseiSugiyama</denchmark-link> , thanks for taking a look. I made the command-line errors a little easier to read in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/175>tensorflow/docs-l10n#175</denchmark-link> , but the script seems to work-as-intended: <denchmark-code># Install deps: $ pip3 install --user absl-py
# Assume you've downloaded both tensorflow/docs and tensorflow/docs-l10n repos $ cd docs-l10n
$ ./tools/nb_code_sync.py --src=../docs/site/en/guide/function.ipynb \ ./site/ja/guide/function.ipynb
Error: Notebooks must have same amount of code cells to sync between. Please manually compare the source and destination notebooks. </denchmark-code>
Unfortunately. these Japanese notebooks are quite out-of-date and missing a number of code cells that are in the en/ source-of-truth. This script assumes that the number of code cells matches between the two notebooks to properly sync. Quickly looking at the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/blob/master/site/ja/guide/function.ipynb>Japanese version</denchmark-link> , I can see that it's missing the "Debugging" section in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/guide/function.ipynb>English version</denchmark-link> (and maybe more). For something like this, you'll have to manually look through and make sure it's structurally similar to the en/ version. nb_code_sync.py is really just meant to keep any code changes up-to-date and avoid too much drift.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lamberta>@lamberta</denchmark-link> Thank you for your kindly reporting! It sounds nice that we will be able to use the after updating these three notebooks (maybe). I made a PR for csv.ipynb <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/176>tensorflow/docs-l10n#176</denchmark-link> and try to update all these notebooks.

I updated related documents by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/176>tensorflow/docs-l10n#176</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/190>tensorflow/docs-l10n#190</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs-l10n/pull/220>tensorflow/docs-l10n#220</denchmark-link> and they've been marged I guess we can safely close this issue. Thank you for your work, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lamberta>@lamberta</denchmark-link> !
Awesome. Thank you <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AseiSugiyama>@AseiSugiyama</denchmark-link> this is great
